---
title: "0. Setup"
---

This tutorial relies on a number of published packages. You can install anything you are missing using the code snippet below.

```{r install packages, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, results='hide'}
# install packages
packReq <- c(
  "tidyverse", "lubridate", "naniar", "summarytools", "leaflet", "mapview", "datacleanr"
)

# Install and load all required packages
lapply(packReq, function(x) {
  print(x)
  if (require(x, character.only = TRUE) == FALSE) {
    install.packages(x)
    library(x, character.only = TRUE)
  }
})
```

We will be working with some example data. To follow along exactly with the paths in this tutorial, you will need to create a folder called 'example_data' and download the following files into that location. The example_data should be within your working directory for Rstudio (if you want to copy and paste code snippets without changing paths).

[sunflower_data_broken.csv](http://nwt.colorado.edu/tutorial_example_data/sunflower_data_broken.csv)

[geocoordinates_example.csv](http://nwt.colorado.edu/tutorial_example_data/geocoordinates_example.csv)

[time_zones.csv](http://nwt.colorado.edu/tutorial_example_data/time_zones.csv)
